FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd source-mac detect-mode command enables the detection of ND attack messages with fixed source MAC addresses and configures a detection mode.
The undo ipv6 nd source-mac detect-mode command restores the monitor mode for the detection of ND attack messages with fixed source MAC addresses. The ipv6 nd source-mac detect-mode command enables the detection of ND attack messages with fixed source MAC addresses and configures a detection mode. The undo ipv6 nd source-mac detect-mode command restores the monitor mode for the detection of ND attack messages with fixed source MAC addresses. The default detection mode is monitor for ND attack entries with fixed source MAC addresses. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: ipv6 nd source-mac detect-mode { filter | monitor }
undo ipv6 nd source-mac detect-mode [ filter | monitor ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a detection mode to filter.

Sets a detection mode to monitor.
